message: Two great one day (sometimes two) learning/sharing opportunities coming up. Saturday August 28 is Barcamp Madison. The sessions are noted here prior to the conference but also posted on a huge posterboard during the day for anyone to tack up a notecard with a session on the rooms & time slot grid. Last year I sat in on a great discussion and sessions from housing potential and issues with foreclosed homes, using RFID to share tools in a neighborhood, to a github and XP overview, and learned of the new Makerspace in Madison Sector67. Web development is a common thread. There are usually at least 5 concurrent sessions, from 30 to 90 minutes, and run from morning until evening. I did not attend Milwaukee BarCamp, but hope to this year. It is happening October 1-2. Last year featured electric car conversion projects, Mono on Android, a Scrum experience report, and of course Web and mobile development technologies, and even sessions on Sunday for children.
